name: European Movement Ireland
legal: A company limited by guarantee and not having a share capital
goal:
European Movement Ireland is an independent, not-for-profit, membership-based organisation working to develop the connection between Ireland and Europe. Founded in 1954, European Movement Ireland is the oldest Irish organisation dealing with the EU, pre-dating Irelandâ€™s membership of the Union in 1973 by almost twenty years.

Our aims are to provide an independent, reasoned, non-governmental voice on European issues; to increase awareness and understanding of European issues among all sectors of Irish people; to disseminate factual information about Europe in language that is clear and understandable; to encourage Irish engagement at European level; and to act as a conduit between Ireland and Europe, representing and articulating Irish opinions to our EU counterparts.

Our vision is for European issues to be discussed in Ireland in a reasoned, robust and fair manner.

Our values include engagement - we work to foster proactive engagement on European issues through innovative, dynamic and creative participation; responsibility - we work to ensure we all take responsibility for the role we play in EU matters and for how we as a people, and as a country, actively engage with Europe; accountability - we work to increase accountability and transparency at both European and Irish levels.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Audiovisual and Media, Budget, Climate Action, Communication, Competition, Consumer Affairs, Culture, Customs, Development, Economic and Financial Affairs, Education, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Enlargement, Enterprise, Environment, External Relations, Financial Stability, Financial Services and Capital Markets Union , Fisheries and Aquaculture, Food Safety, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, General and Institutional Affairs, Home Affairs, Humanitarian Aid, Information Society, Internal Market, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health, Regional Policy, Research and Technology, Sport, Taxation, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport, Youth
euInitiatives: EM Ireland follows the breath of EU initiatives, policies and legislative files, with a distinct focus on those which have a particular impact on Ireland and those related to the areas of Future of Europe, youth, education, graduate jobs, Erasmus+ and language.
